title: B2B Ecosystem
description: How to giving suppliers the tools necessary to reach a global audience for their products, and by helping buyers find products and suppliers

f6_assessments.q0: I believe the core idea of the proposal fit into the challenge  , Integrating cardano blockchain into traditional ERP system is  big challenge but the proposer did not effectively show how the ideas will work with Cardano. Also the Proposal does not include a launch date. , Also the Proposer does not mention the risk and challenges of integration Cardano into already existing ERP system. for that I score 1
f6_assessments.q1:
The Proposer has a great domain experience  and expertise in  ERP system which is good for the successfully implementation of the Project .
But the proposer has not mention his cardano experience whether he is currently learning  or part of the plutus pioneer programme or any intention of such Skills development to build this project. Secondly the proposer does not mention he will hire or seek cardano relevant developer to join his team , based on the information provided , i disagree that this project will be implemented successfully , for that I score 2
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a road map but the items on the list cannot be measurable , because what we cannot measure we cannot audit the progress. based on the information provided , i score 2

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal has three phases. Phase I online bidding and business discovery have a strong case for online use. Phase II is for ERP which is not directly exploiting blockchain and the proposer plans to open source the code. And Phase II is for the Enterprise service bus, which will enable sharing of selected internal details over the blockchain which will establish trust with characteristics of nonrepudation. There's is a substantial use case for such a comprehensive Enterprise solution that can establish cross-organisation data exchange to establish capability.
f6_assessments.q1: The developer has more than 10 years of experience and is presently director of  https://iamsoftware.com.vn. He also claims that they have a working ERP software which they will opensource in phase 2. With this experience and the current state it is possible that the proposal will be able to complete  phase 1 for which funds are requested in this round of catalyst.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a need to get clarity on what is the independence of the Phases. They seem to have isolatable tasks and are better if the deliverables are incremental and independent of future phases. Other than this issue the proposal has a clear list of deliverables in phase I and it is likely to be easy to audit the progress since the development will be open source. The success can be directly established based on the number of adopting firms.

f6_assessments.q0:
The CMS application fits in the DApp challenge. The problem is I'm not sure I understood everything that was said in the proposal and that's kind of a problem because I might have misunderstood some key parts of the project description. 
The impact on the Cardano ecosystem has a chance to be great in the future just because it's B2B. Not sure if now is the right time though.
f6_assessments.q1:
On the bright side, there are a lot of detailed plans describing all functionalities that are already working in a Vietnam company and are planned to be migrated on the Cardano blockchain so the proposers should have a clear idea of the end result. 
On the not-so-bright side, there is a lot of not-so-easy to integrate technologies with the current Cardano stack.
The budget description could be more elaborate and I really really dislike when it says: "Others 2,300$" in a proposal. With the context I have, others don't mean much and should be explained.
I dislike that the company hasn't got a plan for self-funding before the last phase of the proposal, which is way too late when everything will be up and running which might take 2 to 3 years for phase 2 and 3. I misunderstand why the project has included phases 2 and 3 given that they only ask for funds to cover the first phase.
Overall there are a lot of key pieces missing in this proposal IMO.
f6_assessments.q2: The statement "Our code is private, and we will set it as public in the future." really pushes me to be defensive on the auditability side. I like open-source projects because otherwise, the suitability becomes really hard. The community members would have to rely on some kind of reports that the proposer would create instead of having open access to a Github repository.
